thread.title: Destiny USA celebrates 25th anniversary of Carousel Center opening
thread.title_full: Destiny USA celebrates 25th anniversary of Carousel Center opening

author: Katrina Tulloch | ktulloch@syracuse.com
title: Destiny USA celebrates 25th anniversary of Carousel Center opening
text:
Comments 
SYRACUSE, N.Y. -- Destiny USA will celebrate the 25th anniversary of the Carousel Center this week on Thursday, Oct. 15, with free carousel rides, cupcakes and a "Throwback Thursday" Facebook photo contest with $100 gift card prizes. 
Carousel Center, which was rebranded Destiny USA in 2012, opened on Oct. 15, 1990. The mall has grown to become New York's largest shopping, dining and entertainment tourist destination with more than 25 million visits annually. 
Today, 27 stores in Destiny USA have remained since the opening of Carousel Center, including J.C. Penney, Banana Republic, Victoria's Secret and Auntie Anne's Pretzels. The carousel near Destiny USA's food court, seen in a file photo. Al Campanie | The Post-Standard 
Onondaga County Executive Joanie Mahoney described the 1990 opening of Carousel Center as "transformational." 
"Residents and visitors entering our city used to see a scrap yard and oil tanks where Carousel was built," said Mahoney in a statement. "Thanks to great vision and commitment to our community, we have seen it transform into Destiny USA and become a major economic engine in Onondaga County." 
Destiny USA will host several promotional events this weekend to celebrate: 
• Free carousel rides. In celebration of the 25th anniversary, there will be complimentary rides on the carousel from Thursday, Oct. 15 through Sunday, Oct. 18. • "Throwback Thursday" Facebook photo contest. Now through Thursday, Oct. 15, Share a photo of your best memory at Carousel Center from the past 25 years on the Destiny USA Facebook page for a chance to win one of 25 $100 gift cards. • #Carouselfie photo booth. Celebrate the anniversary by snapping and sharing a "#Carouselfie" in a special photo booth in front of the iconic carousel. • Retro music from 1990 . Vanilla Ice. Milli Vanilli. Madonna. Listen for special "retro" music from 1990 played over the mall's PA system throughout the week. • Celebratory cupcakes. Cupcakes will be distributed on Thursday, Oct. 15 at 12:30 p.m. by the carousel, while supplies last. 
Over the past 25 years, Carousel Center and Destiny USA has grown to employ more than 6,000 people annually, and has pumped more than $500 million in taxes and fees into Syracuse and Onondaga County. 
"The start of Carousel Center was definitely a game changer and continues to surpass regional and even international tourism expectations," said Visit Syracuse president David Holder in a statement. "The impact it has had on the local economy and our tourism value as a regional destination is outstanding." 
Destiny USA continues to drive regional tourism and economic growth with its mix of shopping , dining and entertainment venues, including several outlets like Coach, Jos A. Banks, Brooks Brothers and Nordstrom Rack , which opens next week on Oct. 22. 
Katrina Tulloch writes features and entertainment stories for Syracuse.com and The Post-Standard. Contact her: Email | Twitter | Google+
